FAQ.question: Why do I need an FMB Sketch for agricultural land in AP?
FAQ.answer: FMB Sketch helps verify subdivision lines and survey geometry required for land partition, crop mapping, and revenue documentation.

FAQ.question: Does the AP FMB show changes after resurvey or reallocation?
FAQ.answer: Yes, if the resurvey is officially updated in the survey records. Older maps may still reflect pre-resurvey boundaries.

FAQ.question: Can FMB Sketch be used to validate land claimed under inheritance?
FAQ.answer: It supports claim verification by showing how land is mapped under each survey number, but legal proof still requires registered documents.

FAQ.question: Is FMB needed to apply for subdivision or land partition in AP?
FAQ.answer: Yes. FMB measurements are referenced when applying for subdivision or mapping new Khata entries.

FAQ.question: Does FMB Sketch identify government or assigned land in AP?
FAQ.answer: It shows mapped extent and references; classification must be checked separately through land classification records.

FAQ.question: Can FMB be used for crop survey or geo-tagging under government schemes?
FAQ.answer: Yes. FMB helps align survey boundaries with scheme mapping where digital geotagging is required.

FAQ.question: Does the FMB contain settlement-level boundary linking?
FAQ.answer: It may reference boundary lines tied to settlement records, but linkage varies based on district digitization.

FAQ.question: Will FMB reflect encroachments or occupation on ground?
FAQ.answer: No. It provides legal measurements; actual encroachments must be confirmed through ground survey mapping.

FAQ.question: Is FMB required for borewell or irrigation layout planning?
FAQ.answer: It is commonly referenced to position pipelines, channels, and borewell alignment based on surveyed boundaries.

FAQ.question: Is the FMB downloaded from JaaGa authentic?
FAQ.answer: Yes. All AP survey maps are sourced directly from government land and survey databases without modification.
